meanings.definition: The part of an army composed of troops that serve on horseback.
meanings.sent1: The cavalries rode swiftly across the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The king's army included powerful cavalries.
meanings.sent3: The cavalries decided to have a horse race for fun.
meanings.sent4: The image of the cavalries charging into battle was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cavalries' hooves echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A group of people with a shared purpose or goal, typically used in a military or political context.
meanings.sent1: The political party acted as a united cavalries during the election.
meanings.sent2: The cavalries of volunteers worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The book club members formed a cavalries to read more books.
meanings.sent4: The team of doctors acted as a life-saving cavalries during the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The community members banded together like a brave cavalries to support each other.
